column1: 716707`Warner Music Set To Go Public Today
column2: In Anticipated Largest US IPO Of The Year`https://talkmarkets.com/content/warner-music-set-to-go-public-today-in-anticipated-largest-us-ipo-of-the-year?post=264244`TalkMarkets`2020-06-03 00:00:00`GOOG`"Sign up with:Warner Music (WMG) is set to list at the Nasdaq Stock Market on Wednesday.The record label giant is expected to price the initial public offering between $23 to $26 per share
column3: and raise between $11.7 billion and $13.3 billion.According to the Wall Street Journal
column4: Warner Music is aiming towards the higher end of that range for pricing its IPO
column5: which will be the largest year-till-date in the United States.The IPO sector has been battered by the economic impact of the novel coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic
column6: and a number of high-profile listings
column8: are reported to be delayed to next year at least.Warner Music's IPO is to be followed by that of business database startup ZoomInfo on Thursday. The software-as-a-service provider is expected to raise $850 million
column9: which will make it the biggest technology IPO of the year
column10: the Journal reports.If the record label finds success in going public
column11: it could give the confidence for other companies to follow suit
column12: which are otherwise in the wait-and-watch mood due to the pandemic
column13: the Journal noted.The New York-based company was expected to price the IPO late Tuesday but delayed the move in light of the ongoing protests following George Floyd's death
column14: according to the Journal.The music industry called for a ""Blackout Tuesday
column17: and music divisions of Apple Inc.'s (AAPL)
column22: The Verge reported.Warner Music is now expected to decide on the IPO pricing in a meeting early Wednesday ahead of the listing
column23: the Journal noted.Or Sign in withThe comment was deleted!

716710`MoneyGram Shares Jump 50% As Western Union Reportedly Looks For Acquisition`https://talkmarkets.com/content/moneygram-shares-jump-50-as-western-union-reportedly-looks-for-acquisition?post=264127`TalkMarkets`2020-06-02 00:00:00`GOOG`Sign up with:The shares of MoneyGram International Inc. (MGI) skyrocketed on Monday and a premarket session on Tuesday
column2: as Bloomberg reported that Western Union (WU) is looking to acquire the payments company.Western Union has made a takeover offer to MoneyGram
column3: but an agreement is yet to be reached
column4: people familiar with the matter told Bloomberg.The deal
column6: will bring the two veteran money transfer companies together as they struggle to keep their businesses afloat.MoneyGram has about $878 million in debt
column8: and the shelter-in-place orders imposed to curb the spread of the novel coronavirus (COVID-19) gave another setback to its payments infrastructure around the globe.Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holding Ltd.'s (BABA) subsidiary Ant Financial had made an acquisition offer of $1.2 billion to MoneyGram in 2017
column9: but President Donald Trump's administration blocked the deal amid rising tensions with the Chinese government
column10: Reuters reported at the time.Western Union and MoneyGram have been losing ground to financial technology companies like PayPal Holdings Inc. (PYPL)
column13: which provide faster transaction processing at reduced costs.Online payment services offered by technology giants
column15: GOOG) and Apple Inc. (AAPL) present further competition in the field.Social media company Facebook Inc. (FB) is planning to join the fray later this year with the Libra cryptocurrency
column16: which will allow users of its and subsidiary WhatsApp and Instagram's platforms to make direct and quick payments.MoneyGram shares traded 50.58% higher at $3.41 in the pre-market session on Tuesday. The stock had closed the regular session 6.2% higher at $2.59.Western Union shares were up 6.2% in the after-hours at $22 after closing the regular session 3.5% higher at $20.71. Or Sign in withThe comment was deleted!
